alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 09 at 9:17PM EST until January 09 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... The southeastern City of Norfolk in southeastern Virginia... The southeastern City of Chesapeake in southeastern Virginia... The City of Virginia Beach in southeastern Virginia... * Until 1000 PM EST. * At 917 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles east of Buckroe Beach to near South Mills, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Virginia Beach, Regent University, Kempsville, Virginia Wesleyan University, Norfolk, Chesapeake, and Fentress around 925 PM EST. Princess Anne around 930 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Rudee Heights, Mount Pleasant, Princess Anne Plaza, Sigma, Sandbridge Beach, Oceana NAS, Macons Corner, Pungo, Greenbrier, and Bayside. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EST for southeastern Virginia.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Virginia Beach
